metadata.title: CVE-2014-5256 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Node.js 0.8 before 0.8.28 and 0.10 before 0.10.30 does not consider thepossibility of recursive processing that triggers V8 garbage collection inconjunction with a V8 interrupt, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via deep JSONobjects whose parsing lets this interrupt mask an overflow of the programstack.

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
